PHRASE.Comment: This is the only entry for this key.
The names of the months in the nominative case, that is, for use in the format 'Month 2008'.
The names of the week in the nominative case, that is, for use in the format 'Week, Month Date, Year'.
The names of the months in the genitive case, that is, for use in the format 'Wednesday, 28 March 2008'.
The names of the week in the nominative case, that is, for use in the format 'Week, Month Date, Year'.
The names of the months in the genitive case, that is, for use in the format 'Wednesday, 28 March 2008'.

Ве́рсїѧ/,Ponomar is designed to provide the user with access to understand and experience the richness and beauty of the Orthodox tradition. The programme is currently in its developmental phase./,At Ponomar, we believe that Orthodox liturgical texts should be free for use and distribution. God did not copyright the Bible. St John of Damascus did not copyright the Octoechos. Thus, Ponomar and all incorporated texts are distributable under the terms of the GPL./,Copyright/,by/,Acknowledgements: (None)

PHRASE.Comments: To allow different formatting of the tones in other languages, such as Greek (with letters) and Old Church Slavonic (with Cyrillic letters)

длѧ̀ недѣ́ли/,длѧ̀ понедѣ́льника/,длѧ̀ вто́рника/,длѧ̀ сре́ды/,длѧ̀ четвертка̀/,длѧ̀ пѧтка̀/,длѧ̀ сꙋббѡ́ты
PHRASE.Comment: These are the forms put in brackets after transferred readings (Gospel and Apostol).

PHRASE.Value: WW, DD_й де́нь MM YY лѣ́та.
PHRASE.Comment: This will display a type similar to Wednesday, 28 August 2008. The permissible codes are WW for Weekname, DD for the day number, MM for the month, YY for the year. Any additonal formatting can be included such as comma after any number.

PHRASE.Comment: This is the font to be used for displaying all the relevant information on screen for the Main interface. A blank entry of "" will select the default font.
The size of the font for the Main interface, since some languages need a larger font size to be legible. A blank entry will give the default value of 12.

This is the font to be used for displaying information in the Liturgical aspect. At times, the font of the Liturgics will be different from that of the main Screen (for example, Russian interface; Church Slavonic Liturgics).
The size of the font for the Liturgics aspect (see FontFaceL) for explanation, since some languages need a larger font size to be legible. A blank entry will give the default value of 12.
This is the mark to separate the different commemorations that are dispalyed.
This is the mark to separate the readings.
This is for everytime that a colon is required.

This is the 2 letter ISO code for the given language. This will also determine component orientation, for example left-to-right, right-to-left (Hebrew, Arabic, Farsi), top-right-to-bottom-left (Traditional Chinese, Korean, Japanese), and top-left-to-bottom-right (Traditional Mongolian).
This is the 2 letter ISO code for the given country. This may be required later on for some things.

This is the Unicode location for the starting point of the numbers. Changing it to a different starting point will allow any non-Western decimal system to be used. For 'Arabic' numerals (0,1,2,3,4,5...) the starting point is 0!
This allows ideographic numerals to be displayed instead of the normal decimal based values, that is, 145 will be displayed as for example, CXLV. 1 = yes!
This gives the format for the time. The 24-hour clock will be used.

PHRASE.Value: Жи́тїе/,Тропа́рь/, Подо́бенъ: /,Конда́къ/,Гла́съ TT/,; /,Information about this commemoration is missing.
PHRASE.Comment: A space (ifrequired) should be placed before and after the 2nd entry.
